chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven B Quigley was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Cost and Surcharge of $518.00 from case #13CF875, Count #1, to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision Case #14CF358.

Continue with AODA Programs.
AODA Assessment and follow through.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Count #2 was Dismissed.
Case #14CF278 was Dismissed and Read into Case #13CF875 and #14CF358.

Defendant Steven B Quigley in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew H. Huppertz.   Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  

The Court Orders the Following:

Prison Sentence:

5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  CONSEUCTIVE TO CURRENT SENTENCE
- 2 Years of Initial Confinement
- 3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Continue with AODA programs
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment ;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

FINE:  $2658.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  CIty of Waukesha Police Department.
(To to be paid during extended Supervision).

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel on: within first 35 days of extended supervision

Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Steven B Quigley in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Bricco for attorney Joan B. Broughton.   Erik J. Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
